intro: Uvaria welwitschii, commonly known as the African star anise, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces dark purple to black berries that are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Uvaria welwitschii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and medicinal research.
